intro: Brodiaea laxa var. nimia, commonly known as the slender brodiaea, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in well-drained soils in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It blooms in early spring and is known for its delicate appearance and adaptability to dry conditions. This variety is often found in California and parts of Nevada.
